generif.text: DKFZp686O24166 was designated the gene B7-H6; identification as a tumor cell surface molecule that binds NKp30, a receptor which triggers antitumor NK cell cytotoxicity and cytokine secretion

The NKp30-B7-H6 structure revealed that this NK cell activating complex is distinct from the CTLA4-B7 and PD-1-PD-L T cell inhibitory complexes in both overall organization and detailed atomic interactions that mediate binding and specificity.
B7-H6:7D8 represents the first Ab-based molecule stimulating NKp30-mediated NK cell cytotoxicity for therapeutic purposes
These findings reveal that B7-H6 is not only implicated in tumor immunosurveillance but also participates in the inflammatory response in infectious conditions.
B7-H6-positive carcinomas were significantly associated with a higher differentiation.
Data indicate that the ectodomain of NKp30 forms functional homo-oligomers that mediate high affinity binding to its corresponding cellular ligand B7-H6.

this study identified ectodomain shedding of B7-H6 by the metalloproteases "a disintegrin and metalloproteases" (ADAM)-10 and ADAM-17 from the cell surface of tumor cells as a crucial mechanism of expression regulation of B7-H6.
Allogeneic and xenogeneic anti-tumor effect of callithrix jacchus natural killer cells is dependent on NKp30 and B7-H6 interaction.
Study suggests that B7-H6 has a limited value as a prognostic marker in non-small cell lung cancer patients.
the interaction between NKp30 and B7-H6 may contribute to the fate of neuroblastoma patients
Our results suggest that NKP30-B7-H6 interaction can aggravate hepatocyte damage, probably through up-regulation of IL-32 expression in hepatitis B virus-related acute-on-chronic liver failure
our present data revealed that higher B7-H6 expression in ovarian cancer tissues was positively correlated with tumor metastasis and cancer progression

study not only reveals the possibility that tumor therapeutics work as stress inducers to enhance tumor sensitivity to NK cell cytolysis but also suggests that B7-H6 could be a potential target for tumor therapy in the future

NKp30-B7-H6 interaction is a novel cell contact mechanism that mediates activation of Group 2 innate lymphoid cells and identifies a potential target for the development of novel therapeutics for atopic dermatitis and other atopic diseases.
Study confirms that B7-H6 is widely expressed in B-cell lymphomas and demonstrates its important role in the pathogenesis and chemosensitivity of lymphoma.
B7H6-derived peptides trigger TNF-alpha-dependent immunostimulatory activity of lymphocytic NK92-MI cells.
Data suggest that B7-H6 play an important role in the regulation of the biological behavior of glioma cells.

Data indicate a sequence of events driven by tumour-derived prostaglandin D2 (PGD2) associated with engagement of the natural cytotoxicity triggering receptor 3 (NKp30)-B7H6 antigen (B7H6) pathway leading to significant group 2 innate lymphoid cells (ILC2s) activation and expansion.
these studies find that soluble B7H6 is constitutively expressed during pregnancy

B7-H6 was expressed in gliomas and correlated with glioma progression. Knockdown of B7-H6 inhibited glioma cell proliferation, colony formation, migration, and invasion via upregulation of E-cadherin and Bax, and downregulation of vimentin, N-cadherin, MMP-2, MMP-9 and survivin.

Altogether, these data suggested that the defective expression of NKp30 may be induced by the chronic engagement of this receptor by B7-H6 expressed on HIV-2-infected target cells. This represents a novel mechanism by which the chronic ligand exposure by the viral environment may subvert NK-cell-mediated function to establish persistent HIV-2 infection.
The prognostic value of B7-H6 in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma.
Immunological role and underlying mechanisms of B7-H6 in tumorigenesis.
Positive staining of the immunoligand B7-H6 in abnormal/transformed keratinocytes consistently accompanies the progression of cervical cancer.
Preferential Expression of B7-H6 in Glioma Stem-Like Cells Enhances Tumor Cell Proliferation via the c-Myc/RNMT Axis.
Dual role of B7-H6 as a novel prognostic marker in hepatocellular carcinoma.
Large remodeling of the Myc-induced cell surface proteome in B cells and prostate cells creates new opportunities for immunotherapy.
NCR3LG1 (B7-H6) is a potential prognostic factor for bladder cancer patients.
Secreted Ligands of the NK Cell Receptor NKp30: B7-H6 Is in Contrast to BAG6 Only Marginally Released via Extracellular Vesicles.
Immune checkpoint molecules B7-H6 and PD-L1 co-pattern the tumor inflammatory microenvironment in human breast cancer.
B7-H6 as a Diagnostic Biomarker for Cervical Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
B7-H6 enhances F-actin rearrangement by targeting c-MYC activation to promote medulloblastoma migration and invasion.
B7H6 silencing increases chemosensitivity to dacarbazine and suppresses cell survival and migration in cutaneous melanoma.

name: natural killer cell cytotoxicity receptor 3 ligand 1

reactome.name: Immunoregulatory interactions between a Lymphoid and a non-Lymphoid cell

summary: B7H6 belongs to the B7 family (see MIM 605402) and is selectively expressed on tumor cells. Interaction of B7H6 with NKp30 (NCR3; MIM 611550) results in natural killer (NK) cell activation and cytotoxicity (Brandt et al., 2009 [PubMed 19528259]).[supplied by OMIM, Jan 2011].
